ai-iti108:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti108:2.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of mine.
ai-iti108:2.2_0: Those mendicants have left this teaching and training.
ai-iti108:2.2_1: They don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-iti108:2.3_0: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, wise, amenable, and serene: they are mendicants of mine.
ai-iti108:2.4_0: and those monks haven’t left this teaching and training.
ai-iti108:2.4_1: do they achieve growth, improvement, and maturity in this teaching and training?”
ai-iti108:2.5_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti108:3.1_0: “Where will those who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers,
ai-iti108:3.4_0: that was taught by the perfected Buddha.
ai-iti108:4.1_0: But those who are genuine, not flatterers, wise,
ai-iti108:4.3_0: these do grow in the teaching
ai-iti108:4.4_0: that was taught by the perfected Buddha.”
ai-iti108:5.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
